page.title: 01The Village of Collingham
page.content: Collingham is a large village with a population of over 2500.There are more than 1000 houses,many of them built during the last 15 years.The village was once distinctly{North Collingham} and{South Collingham}but over the years a gradual merging has taken place.Large estates,both council and private have been built on the eastern side with development now reaching saturation point.Because of this,Collingham now boasts a{modern {health centre and library} .Conversely,there are very few shops as the majority of people now do their shopping in the supermarkets of Newark and nearby Lincoln. Situated a kilometre or more east of the River Trent,often there is flooding,usually in the older part of the village.Much of the old village is now a{conservation area.}
